responses.rationale: Factual reporting of case locations and types without explicit framing cues.
Reports a characteristic ('high mortality rates') factually; no added alarmist framing.
Factual report of status ('test results pending') without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of confirmed infection using technical term 'highly pathogenic avian influenza'.
Factual report of a positive test result in a location/type of flock.
Uses 'concerning' which is a mild evaluation, not strong framing or vivid impact description.
Provides instructional advice on safe food preparation, not explicit calming language.
Factual description of potential transmission modes using neutral language.
Factual report of sequence and locations of virus discovery.
Reports a low-risk fact ('rare') factually, without explicit reassuring framing.
Factual report of locations where avian flu is present; 'dealing with' is neutral idiom.
Factual reporting of latest case locations and types.
Factual report of virus history and spread across time and locations.
Factual report of a lack of information about a procedure.
